title: Drawing, "Design for a Tabernacle Door to be Executed in Bronze", ca. 1725
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on paper
inscribed: At lower right: "No 2" and the monogram as in -1143: GBC. Above in another handwriting, probably of the man making the comission: G. Ciacchetti; that may mean his signature or the name of the artist.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Two angels are supporting a pavilion with the chalice and the host, the roof is shaped as a crown. Between the mantles of the angels, a socle with a pelican on top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Tabernacle Door to be Executed in Bronze", ca. 1725.
ca. 1725. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2526.
